title: Ticket #1830: autoclustering ignores attributes in the proc ad
description:
Attributes in the proc ad (i.e. not the cluster ad) that are referenced without explicit MY scope are ignored by autoclustering. The problem likely dates to 7.5.2, but it became more visible after commit [19048] in pre-releases of 7.5.5 which made custom attributes go into the proc ad instead of the cluster ad as they used to.

The problem is that ClassAd::GetInternalReferences() contains the following: 

    state.curAd = tree->GetParentScope();
    if(!state.curAd) state.curAd = this;

So for job ads, all lookups are done in the scope of the cluster ad. Similar code exists in ClassAd::GetExternalReferences(). This behavior seems wrong in both cases.
